js
Class JSDateEntry

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              js.JSDateEntry
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.FocusListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener
public class JSDateEntry
extends javax.swing.JComponent
implements java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.FocusListener, java.awt.event.ActionListener

JSDateEntry provides a number of different ways for the user to enter a date. DROPDOWN_VIEW provides three dropdown lists, one each for date, month and year. MULTI_TEXTFIELD_VIEW provides three text fields for the user to type in the date, month and year. CALENDAR_BUTTON_VIEW provides an uneditable text field and a button to open a popup calendar, where the user can click a date to select it.

A JSDateEntry component can be given an initial date, and a limit can be set on the number of years to show in the past and future from the current date.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Josh Sunshine
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

JSDateEntry

public JSDateEntry()
Creates a new JSDateEntry using DROPDOWN_VIEW and no initial date. The year dropdown will contain 25 past years and 5 future years.

JSDateEntry

public JSDateEntry(int viewType)
Creates a new JSDateEntry with the specified view type and no initial date. If DROPDOWN_VIEW or CALENDAR_BUTTON_VIEW are used, they will display 25 past years and 5 future years.

Parameters:
viewType - an integer representing the type of entry to use for this JSDateEntry.

JSDateEntry

public JSDateEntry(java.util.Calendar initialDate)
Creates a new JSDateEntry using DROPDOWN_VIEW and the specified initial date. The year dropdown will contain 25 past years and 5 future years.

Parameters:
initialDate - the date to set this JSDateEntry to when initialising.

JSDateEntry

public JSDateEntry(int viewType,
                   java.util.Calendar initialDate)
Creates a new JSDateEntry with the specified view type and the specified initial date. If DROPDOWN_VIEW or CALENDAR_BUTTON_VIEW are used, they will display 25 past years and 5 future years.

Parameters:
viewType - an integer representing the type of entry to use for this JSDateEntry.
initialDate - the date to set this JSDateEntry to when initialising.

JSDateEntry

public JSDateEntry(int viewType,
                   java.util.Calendar initialDate,
                   int yearsBehind)
Creates a new JSDateEntry with the specified view type and the specified initial date. If DROPDOWN_VIEW or CALENDAR_BUTTON_VIEW are used, they will display the specified number of years in the past and 5 years in the future.

Parameters:
viewType - an integer representing the type of entry to use for this JSDateEntry.
initialDate - the date to set this JSDateEntry to when initialising.
yearsBehind - an integer number of years to display in this JSDateEntry in the past from the current year.

JSDateEntry

public JSDateEntry(int viewType,
                   java.util.Calendar initialDate,
                   int yearsBehind,
                   int yearsAhead)
Creates a new JSDateEntry with the specified view type and the specified initial date. If DROPDOWN_VIEW or CALENDAR_BUTTON_VIEW are used, they will display the specified number of years in the past and the future.

Parameters:
viewType - an integer representing the type of entry to use for this JSDateEntry.
initialDate - initialDate the date to set this JSDateEntry to when initialising.
yearsBehind - an integer number of years to display in this JSDateEntry in the past from the current year.
yearsAhead - an integer number of years to display in this JSDateEntry in the future from the current year.

getDate

public java.util.Calendar getDate()
Returns the current date from this JSDateEntry.

Returns:
a Calendar object representing the date entered into this JSDate entry, or null if one has not been entered.
